title: Compiling contracts hangs
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (da73576 2022-06-04T00:13:25.46512185Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Hey all!

Recently, I've been having an issue with my project "fether" while trying to solve ethernaut challenges.
While doing the "Puzzle Wallet" which utilizes solc:0.6.2 because of it's UpgradeableProxy.sol dependency, the compiler hangs at 
```
[⠊] Compiling...
[⠃] Compiling 57 files with 0.6.2^C
```
In order to running my tests, I ran `forge test --match-contract PuzzleWalletTest --use solc:0.6.2 -vv`

This is the output of running `RUST_LOG=ethers=trace forge build --force --use solc:0.6.2` to see what's going on:

```
2022-06-04T20:18:30.754112Z TRACE ethers_solc: clean up project
[⠃] Compiling...2022-06-04T20:18:30.755211Z TRACE compile: ethers_solc: found 44 sources to compile: ["/home/franfran/VimProjects/dapps/fether/src/CoinFlip/Level.sol", "/home/franfran/VimProjects/dapps/fether/src/Delegation/Level.sol", "/home/franfran/VimProjects/dapps/fether/src/Denial/Denial.sol", "/home/franfran/VimProjects/dapps/fether/src/Denial/Level.sol", You're hitting this error on 0.6.2, https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/8656. Try `forge build --use 0.6.12`, it works.
```
